trans-unit.source: App requirements for Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: App requirements for Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Learn about the requirements for apps that you want to use in Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Learn about the requirements for apps that you want to use in Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: App requirements
trans-unit.target: App requirements

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp supports streaming 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications from a Windows Server 2012 R2 image.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp supports streaming 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications from a Windows Server 2012 R2 image.

trans-unit.source: Most existing 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications run "as is" in Azure RemoteApp (Remote Desktop Services or formerly known as Terminal Services) environment.
trans-unit.target: Most existing 32-bit or 64-bit Windows-based applications run "as is" in Azure RemoteApp (Remote Desktop Services or formerly known as Terminal Services) environment.

trans-unit.source: However, there is a difference between running and running well - some applications function correctly and perform well, while others do not.
trans-unit.target: However, there is a difference between running and running well - some applications function correctly and perform well, while others do not.

trans-unit.source: The following information provides guidance for developing applications in a Remote Desktop Services environment and testing to ensure compatibility.
trans-unit.target: The following information provides guidance for developing applications in a Remote Desktop Services environment and testing to ensure compatibility.

trans-unit.source: Tip: We're working on creating some working examples of apps for you.
trans-unit.target: Tip: We're working on creating some working examples of apps for you.

trans-unit.source: You'll see new topics that discuss using Microsoft Access, QuickBooks, and App-V in RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: You'll see new topics that discuss using Microsoft Access, QuickBooks, and App-V in RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: These three requirements, if followed, help your application run well in RemoteApp:
trans-unit.target: These three requirements, if followed, help your application run well in RemoteApp:

trans-unit.source: Applications that meet all [Certification requirements for Windows desktop apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh749939.aspx) and adhere to [Remote Desktop Services programming guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa383490.aspx) will have complete compatibility with RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Applications that meet all [Certification requirements for Windows desktop apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh749939.aspx) and adhere to [Remote Desktop Services programming guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa383490.aspx) will have complete compatibility with RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Applications should never store data locally on the image or RemoteApp instances that can be lost.
trans-unit.target: Applications should never store data locally on the image or RemoteApp instances that can be lost.

trans-unit.source: After you create a RemoteApp collection, the instances are cloned and are stateless and should only contain applications.
trans-unit.target: After you create a RemoteApp collection, the instances are cloned and are stateless and should only contain applications.

trans-unit.source: Store data in an external source or within the user's profile.
trans-unit.target: Store data in an external source or within the user's profile.

trans-unit.source: Custom images should never contain data that can be lost.
trans-unit.target: Custom images should never contain data that can be lost.

trans-unit.source: Testing your apps
trans-unit.target: Testing your apps

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to testing applications:
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to testing applications:

trans-unit.source: Install Windows Server 2012 R2 and your application
trans-unit.target: Install Windows Server 2012 R2 and your application

trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Create two user accounts, UserA and UserB, adding both user accounts to the Remote Desktop security group.
trans-unit.target: Create two user accounts, UserA and UserB, adding both user accounts to the Remote Desktop security group.

trans-unit.source: Check multi-session compatibility by establishing two simultaneous RDS sessions to the PC while launching the application.
trans-unit.target: Check multi-session compatibility by establishing two simultaneous RDS sessions to the PC while launching the application.

trans-unit.source: Validate app behavior
trans-unit.target: Validate app behavior

trans-unit.source: Application development guidelines
trans-unit.target: Application development guidelines

trans-unit.source: Use the following guidelines for developing applications for RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Use the following guidelines for developing applications for RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Multiple users
trans-unit.target: Multiple users

trans-unit.source: Installing an [application for a single user ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380661.aspx)can create problems in a multiuser environment.
trans-unit.target: Installing an [application for a single user ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380661.aspx)can create problems in a multiuser environment.

trans-unit.source: Applications should [store user-specific information](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa383452.aspx) in user-specific locations, separately from global information that applies to all users.
trans-unit.target: Applications should [store user-specific information](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa383452.aspx) in user-specific locations, separately from global information that applies to all users.

trans-unit.source: RemoteApp uses multiple [namespaces for kernel objects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa382954.aspx); a global namespace is used primarily by services in client/server applications.
trans-unit.target: RemoteApp uses multiple [namespaces for kernel objects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa382954.aspx); a global namespace is used primarily by services in client/server applications.

trans-unit.source: It is not safe to assume that the computer name or the [IP address](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa382942.aspx) assigned to the computer are associated with a single user because multiple users can be logged on simultaneously to a Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server.
trans-unit.target: It is not safe to assume that the computer name or the [IP address](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa382942.aspx) assigned to the computer are associated with a single user because multiple users can be logged on simultaneously to a Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server.

trans-unit.source: Performance
trans-unit.target: Performance

trans-unit.source: Disable [graphic effects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380822.aspx) before you add your app to RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Disable [graphic effects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380822.aspx) before you add your app to RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: To maximize CPU availability for all users, either disable [background tasks ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380665.aspx) or create efficient background tasks that are not resource-intensive.
trans-unit.target: To maximize CPU availability for all users, either disable [background tasks ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380665.aspx) or create efficient background tasks that are not resource-intensive.

trans-unit.source: You should tune and balance application [thread usage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa383520.aspx) for a multiuser, multiprocessor environment.
trans-unit.target: You should tune and balance application [thread usage](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa383520.aspx) for a multiuser, multiprocessor environment.

trans-unit.source: To optimize performance, it is good practice for applications to [detect](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380798.aspx) whether they are running in a client session.
trans-unit.target: To optimize performance, it is good practice for applications to [detect](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa380798.aspx) whether they are running in a client session.
